column4: Howdy folks, I'm having some trouble with samba between ubuntu edgy and windows xp. I have them connected via cat6s and a gigabit switch and if I browse, send & recieve files using the windows machine it works ok
but when I use ubuntu to browse files on the windows machine, it goes via the internet rather than just the switch
how do you know it goes via the internet?
it slows down to roughly my upload speed :P
which is 1.5-3 Mbps
ah, that's a good one
common problem or are you kidding? ;P
you tried connecting on LAN address? (assuming you're working on a LAN)
the thing is they both have individual IPs (External ones)
but they are on the same LAN?
same physical network
you could try to put them in the same subnet
what does that mean?
Well, for example: if computer A has the LAN address 192.168.2.1, you could give computer B 192.168.2.2
Assuming both addresses are not in use yet
I see what you mean
Unfortunately I play games alot on one and host servers on the other and I would hate to not be able to connect to them easily
do you think two nics would be an option?
Shouldn't be a problem, just make sure you have the ports forwarded to it's new address on the gaming PC
thanks for the info, I'll ponder over my options :P
You're welcome, happy pondering ;)
